intro: Trichomanes tenellum, commonly known as the small maidenhair fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. Its spore-producing structures, called sorus, are located on the underside of the fronds. Trichomanes tenellum is characterized by its finely divided leaves and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
